headline: Defense Stocks Drop. Secretary Hegseth Could Be Replaced: Report.
summary: The U.S. defense industry has had a busy few days—a CEO change, unlikely rivals for a big contract.  Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth is under fire again for sharing details about U.S. strikes on Houthi rebels in Yemen via a chat group on the Signal app—this time with his wife and aides who didn’t need real-time information about the operation, The Wall Street Journal reported.  The Defense Department didn’t respond to a request for comment about the report.

headline: Unlocking Q1 Potential of L3Harris (LHX): Exploring Wall Street Estimates for Key Metrics
summary: Beyond analysts' top -and-bottom-line estimates for L3Harris (LHX), evaluate projections for some of its key metrics to gain a better insight into how the business might have performed for the quarter ended March 2025.

headline: Why Resilient GPS (R-GPS) Matters for US Military Superiority: We Must Address GPS Vulnerabilities
summary: R-GPS gives warfighters a decisive battlefield advantage by punching through adversary jammers -wherever and whenever they need it, writes, Jeff Hanke, Space Systems President, in Space News.*...
